args:
When the trial resumes, Jupiter exposes the
prosecutor for all his evil misdeeds and asserts
his arguments are invalid. Jupiter then requests
a retrial, but the furious prosecutor attempts to
disrupt the proceedings by summoning a gang
of imperial soldiers to the courtroom.
Uuuuugh... It's over... IT'S ALL OVER!
It's not like taking a recess is going to\nhelp the situation any.
I knew we'd never win in this court...
Now, now! No need to get pessimistic.\nYou refused to give up back when I took on\nthis case, so why start doing so now?
Your ancestor never gave up, and I know\nyou have the same sort of steel in you.
My ＂ancestor＂? What the heck are you\ntalking about now?

Ah, yes. I suppose that's a bit out of left
field. Allow me to explain! You see,
I spent a bit of time with one of your
ancestors some 200 years ago.
Two hundred years ago? But that's when\nmy family revitalized the town with the\nhelp of a...
HOLY CRAP! Are YOU the dragon who\nhelped us?! You're a HERO in our family!\nWe've talked about you for generations!

You know, I wondered why Jupiter was
willing to come out here and help some
random human, because that's really not
his style—but now I get it.
When you said you had ties to this place,\nyou were referring to your friendship with\nthis ancestor of Eryn's, right?
Indeed I was! Probably should have\nmentioned that early, but, well, you know.\nI've been busy and so forth.
That's sort of an important thing to leave\nout, bub! I'm not entirely sure I believe it.

I mean, the dragon of legend was said to
have a nasty, cheeky attitude, but also be
more dependable than anyone in the world
and also unbelievably handsome!
I'd question what exactly your family is\nsaying about me, but I like the last part,\nso I'll let it slide.
Anyway, that very same dragon is now\nyour lawyer, so try putting a bit more\nfaith in me, mmm?
Okay, but we still haven't found a way to\nrefute the prosecution's false testimony.
Correct you are. However, that doesn't\nmean we have no hope of winning.
Remember what I said about playing in\nthe mud if we had to? I'll get you that\ninnocent verdict—just give me some time.
Okay, you win. I'm sorry I lost my cool,\nand I promise to believe in you again.
Oh, I will! Also, this is going to be all\nkinds of fun, so make sure you don't\nmiss a second of the action.
Hear ye, hear ye! Court is again in session!\nHas the defense found a suitable argument\nagainst the prosecution's claims?
You bet your buns we have, Your Honor!
The shopkeeper said the person who\nbought the murder weapon looked like\nmy client, did he not?
However, I looked into the matter during\nthe recess, and found no physical evidence\nthat the buyer was, in fact, female.
Which means there is still a question as\nto the veracity of the prosecution's claim.
Nonsense and balderdash! A testimony is\nmore than just mere words—it is a true\nand verified statement made under oath!
But without material evidence, we can't\ndeny the possibility that a testimony may\nbe untrue, now can we?

I feel there's something more going on,
given that the witness retracted his
statement to the Templars—who are not
the kind of folks you want to mess with.
Then let me turn this theory back on you:\nWhere is your evidence that proves the\nwitness's testimony is unreliable?

Because without evidence, you have
nothing but air; you cannot squelch my
argument simply because you FEEL that
it may be off somehow.
Oh, I have no evidence whatsoever.
Of COURSE you don't! Clearly, your efforts\nto buy time were a sham just as I thought!
I can't believe I was even worried!\nYou truly are a sad excuse for a lawyer.\nAh ha! Aaaaaah ha ha ha ha!
You think you've won, and that's just fine—\nand it's also fine that I still haven't poked\nany holes in your little theory.
Because my real goal with the recess and\nall of this was to drag out the trial until\njuuuust about...now.
Heh. You still don't see it, do you?
What are you scheming here, sir?
Oh, but it's no fun to just say it out loud\nwhen I can just show you instead!
We are the Templars! In the name of\nthe Goddess Ilia, we are here to arrest\nProsecutor Guaron!
What is the meaning of this?!\nThere is a trial happening here!
May it please the court, we have finally\nreceived evidence that prove this\nprosecutor's misdeeds!

We have proof that he was responsible for
the unjust removal of the former mayor,
and that's just the start. We have him!
Oh, but it is a glorious day!
But that's impossible! My residence is\nheavily guarded, and there's no way you\ncould have gotten any—AH!
Looks like you finally see it! Sadly, you\nwere so focused on this little sham trial,\nyou left your mansion shorthanded.
Thank you for the tip, good sir. He won't\nbe able to talk his way out of this one.\nRope him up, boys!
Now you will finally taste the justice you\nmade a mockery of for so long!
Uh, so while I'm loving most of this,\ncan someone tell me what the heck's\ngoing on?
I don't think Jupiter ever had any intention\nof actually finishing this case.
He knew he couldn't win, so instead he\ndecided to have the prosecutor arrested\nand a mistrial declared.
Wait, but when did he manage to have\nthat kind of a talk with the Templar... Oh.

What's the saying? It takes a troublemaker
to know a troublemaker or...something?
Point is, if he's going to play dirty,
we might as well get down in the mud.
Worry not, my fine clients! I'm off to take\ncare of a couple of things and ensure that\nwe win the day tomorrow!
Your evil deeds have now been laid bare\nfor all to see, Gauron.
This also clearly calls into doubt the\nlegitimacy of the witness you prepared.
Therefore, I ask the court for a retrial\nwith a different prosecutor standing in.\nWhat say you, Your Honor?
The defense's motion is granted.\nWe will adjourn for today and reconvene\nthis hearing at a later date.
Yo, yo, yo! Imperials in the house!\nWe ain't quiet as a mouse,\nwe be noisy like a grouse!
There is no way an absolute perfection\nlike myself can lose in such a way!
I'd hoped to do this peacefully, but now\nI have little choice. Now seize the key\nand that feckless traitor prince!
Getting arrested only made you more\ndesperate, Gauron. Even a cornered\nbeast should know when he's bested!
Say what you will, fool! Once I have the\ntreasure, the crimes I have committed here\nwill be of no consequence!
All of you will die this day! Aaah ha ha ha!\nGoodness, but this is fun! I should really\nhave taken this route from the start...
But before your end, I will show you the\npower locked away inside this sacred\ntreasure! Aaaaah ha ha ha ha ha!
